mil3.1.1:1.1: Then, King Milinda approached Venerable Nāgasena, exchanged cordial and polite greetings with him, and sat down at one side.
mil3.1.1:1.2: Venerable Nāgasena, by returning polite greetings back, gladdened King Milinda’s heart.
mil3.1.1:2.1: Then, King Milinda said to Venerable Nāgasena,
mil3.1.1:2.2: “How is the reverend one known, what is your name, venerable sir?”
mil3.1.1:2.3: “I am called Nāgasena, your majesty, my holy life companions address me as Nāgasena. Though parents make such names as Nāgasena, or Sūrasena, or Vīrasena, or Sīhasena, your majesty, Nāgasena is only a concept, a designation, a label, an appellation, a mere name; no person actually obtains here.”
mil3.1.1:3.2: “May the venerable five hundred Bactrian Greeksand the eighty thousand bhikkhus hear me. This Nāgasena said,
mil3.1.1:3.3: ‘no person obtains here’; is it proper toapprove that?”
mil3.1.1:3.4: Then, King Milinda said this to VenerableNāgasena,
mil3.1.1:3.5: “If, bhante Nāgasena, no person obtains, who therefore gives you robes, alms food, lodgings and medicinal requisites? Who enjoys the use of them? Who guards their ethical behaviour? Who engages in meditation? Who attains the path and fruit of Nibbāna? Who kills a living being? Who takes what is not given? Who commits wrong conduct in sensual pleasures? Who speaks falsely? Who drinks intoxicants? Who commits any of the five deeds that bear fruit without delay? Therefore, there is nothing wholesome, nothing unwholesome. There is no doer of wholesome and unwholesome deeds, nor anyone who makes another do wholesome or unwholesome deeds. There is no fruit or result of good or bad deeds. If, venerable Nāgasena, there was someone who caused you to die, there is no killing of living beings for that person. Venerable Nāgasena, there is no teacher, no preceptor, and no ordination for you.
mil3.1.1:3.6: “You say ‘my holy life companions address me as Nāgasena.’ But who here is Nāgasena?
mil3.1.1:3.7: Is it, venerable sir, that the hairs of the head are Nāgasena?”
mil3.1.1:3.9: “Are the hairs of the body Nāgasena?”
mil3.1.1:3.52: “Then, venerable sir, are form, feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness combined Nāgasena?”
mil3.1.1:3.54: “Then, venerable sir, is something other than form, feeling, perception, formations, consciousness combined Nāgasena?”
mil3.1.1:3.56: “Though, venerable sir, I am asking you repeatedly, I do not see Nāgasena.
mil3.1.1:3.59: “Then, who here is Nāgasena? You speak a falsehood, venerable sir, there is no Nāgasena.”
